intro: Icacorea longicaudata, commonly known as the long-tailed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture. Icacorea longicaudata thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens.
